comments.description:
This file contains the Gallium API specification which all drivers must implement.
It contains all enums and functions, including those provided by various other driver vendors.
The extension to which a function or enum belongs is defined in its extension attribute. An example could be GA_ULTZ_extension_name. The vendor which added the extension to the Gallium specification is defined in its vendor attribute. In the case of GA_ULTZ_extension_name, the vendor will just be ULTZ. If the extension name is "Core", that means the function is part of the main API specification. The vendor attribute will be filled with the vendor who championed that particular portion of the Gallium API specification.
Currently, the only vendor is ULTZ, who make the following drivers: - Gallium -> DirectX - Gallium -> Vulkan - Gallium -> OpenGL(ES) - Gallium -> Metal
Extensions that all drivers/vendors can implement are defined in the EXT vendor. This is the where functions and enums are added BEFORE being added to the main API specification. Once the vast majority of the vendors have implemented the EXT extension, it will be added to a future version of the Gallium spec unless the majority of vendors decide against it (and want to keep it as an extension). Vendors have no obligation to implement EXT extensions.
Gallium creates, modifies, and destroys graphics resources on the underlying API through Create*, Update/Get/Set*, and Destroy* functions; the first of which returning a unique resource ID that is passed to the latter two functions. This resource ID is not unique to the resource type, but is instead unique to every resource on the API. For example, a framebuffer and texture will never have the same ID.

type.name: GAIntPtr
type.comment: An int pointing to an address in memory.

type.name: GADebugProc
type.comment: A function pointer to a debug callback.

type.name: GABool
type.comment: A boolean - 0 for false, 1 for true.
